<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Despite spending every day together, we realized we know basically nothing about you except your email address (shoutout to everyone still clinging to AOL).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s a problem because having just a little more info would allow us to make our content better for you. For example, if 90% of our audience lived in California we’d probably write “the” before mentioning interstate highways so you wouldn’t be confused. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s a silly joke, but in all seriousness, we’d be grateful if you <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/onboarding?user={{profile.vars.access_token}}&redirect=/daily" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filled out this short form</a> to allow us to get to know you better. If you need an extra push, we’re also giving away $50 Amazon gift cards to 10 readers who complete the survey.* Thanks in advance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>—Neal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Sherry Qin</em></p>

Home Depot’s Q2 results showed that there are only so many decks one homeowner can possibly build; the pandemic-era DIY boom is effectively over.</span>

The TSA also </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/17/biden-administration-set-to-extend-mask-mandate-for-travel-through-mid-january.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extended</a></span><span> its mask requirement on flights, buses, and trains through Jan. 18. </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/can-kids-revive-retail?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Can Kids Revive Retail?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/can-kids-revive-retail?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Big Mouth shopping scene" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l1J9rURykdgphbkLS/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Big Mouth shopping scene" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l1J9rURykdgphbkLS/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Big Mouth</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They may roll their eyes, have cooties, and never admit they started it, but kids are <em>really </em>good at making you buy them things—and that may be key to jumpstarting a stagnant retail industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the return to in-person education, total back-to-school spending in the US will hit a <a href="https://nrf.com/media-center/press-releases/2021-brings-back-class-shopping-record-levels?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record $37.1 billion</a> this year, up from $33.9 billion in 2020, according to the National Retail Federation’s annual survey. Families with children in elementary through high school plan to spend an average of $848.90 on school supplies, a $59 increase over last year.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Stores could use the youthful energy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Retail sales fell <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/17/retail-sales-july-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than expected</a> (-1.1%) in July, the Commerce Department said yesterday. That dip can likely be explained by skittishness over the Delta variant, as well as a broader shift in spending from goods to services during the summer.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Walmart and Home Depot, which both reported earnings yesterday, revealed a </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmarts-sales-rise-even-as-online-orders-cool-11629200484?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slowdown</a></span><span> in sales growth from earlier this year. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And remember, consumer sentiment plunged to its lowest level since 2011 last month.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Plus, we’re in a pandemic</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And that means things cost more and there’s not enough of them.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With inflation on the rise, consumers should expect to pay </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/shopping/2021/07/23/school-supply-shortage-backpack-shoes-could-sell-out/8071293002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10%–15% more</a></span><span> compared to last year for apparel, according to USA Today. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Chalk, wooden block sets, and dry-erase markers are in short supply due to shipping delays and other supply chain hiccups, </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/08/16/school-shortages-bus-drivers-counselors-computer/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to the Washington Post</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Even worse, a Cincinnati-area Walmart ran out of all </span><span><a href="https://www.wcpo.com/money/consumer/dont-waste-your-money/back-to-school-shopping-families-facing-shortages-and-higher-prices?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Disney backpacks</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On the bright side...</strong>if Walmart is any indication (it is), the back-to-school shopping season has started off with a bang. The retailer said its stores were busy with parents buying backpacks, lunch boxes, and other school supplies for their kids, and even raised its revenue outlook for the year. — <em>NF</em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/biden-administration-expected-advise-boosters-americans?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Booster Shots: A Matter of When, Not If
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hope you have enough storage in your phone for one more vaccine selfie: The White House is expected to announce this week that most Americans will <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/16/us/politics/booster-shots.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">need a Covid booster shot</a> eight months after their second doses. After the FDA authorized Pfizer’s and Moderna’s boosters for some Americans last week, the third dose could be available for your arm as early as mid-September, per the NYT. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why booster shots?</strong> Growing case numbers in highly vaccinated countries show that vaccine effectiveness may wear off over time, particularly against the Delta variant.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Israel reported that the Pfizer vaccine’s effectiveness against severe disease has fallen to as low as 55% for elderly people who received their second shots in January or February. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nearly 1 million Israelis have </span><span><a href="https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/covid-vaccine-israel-one-million-booster-shot-delta-variant-1.10121503?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">already received</a></span><span> booster shots.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NIH Director Dr. Francis Collins said the data from Israel prompted US health officials to rethink their position on dose No. 3.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out</strong>: Wealthy countries are full-steam ahead with their booster programs, despite the WHO calling on them to share vaccines with lower-income nations first. <em>– SQ</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CREATOR ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/onlyfans-launches-sfw-app?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
OnlyFans Goes SFW
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/onlyfans-launches-sfw-app?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Screenshot from OFTV app featuring a vegan taco video" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjgxL3NjcmVlbnNob3RfZnJvbV9vZnR2X2FwcC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>OFTV</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We still don’t recommend scrolling through OnlyFans at work, but the company’s latest product—a new app for Android and iOS—is much closer to PG.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Until now, the platform known for connecting fans with their favorite NSFW creators has been barred from appearing on Google's and Apple’s app stores. The workaround: a new product called OFTV that contains a library of over 800 videos featuring the same creators from its site...but with <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2021-08-15/onlyfans-creates-its-first-app-with-a-twist-no-nudity-no-cost?sref=ExbtjcSG" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more clothing</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For instance, OFTV users can watch the original series </span><span><em>Unlocked</em></span><span>, which features candid chats with famous OnlyFans creators including Mia Khalifa and Bella Thorne.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">OFTV won’t make any money</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least not directly. Instead, the app will act as a marketing vehicle for the main website experience. And while OFTV won’t ditch the creators who helped drive OnlyFans revenue <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/26/onlyfans-grew-revenue-553-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">553% higher</a> last year, the app will also feature chefs, pilates instructors, and podcasters.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why? </strong>The OFTV app is part of OnlyFans’s ongoing push to more closely align itself with other fan-fueled platforms like Substack and Patreon, rather than PornHub Premium, as it eyes a unicorn valuation. — <em>JW</em></p>

" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjE5L2hlaXNtYW5fdHJvcGh5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>More than a month ago, college athletes were granted the ability to earn $$$ off their name, image, and likeness (NIL). So how much are they making? A D1 athlete <a href="https://twitter.com/RossDellenger/status/1425816340741324804?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earned $471</a> on average in July, with football players capturing 79% of all NIL market share, per the marketing platform Opendorse. The most popular way to make money was via social media promotions (46% of all NIL money earned).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “This is an extraordinary time, and I believe that it will result in an extraordinary generation. You will see the world differently than your predecessors. You have been forced, sooner than most people, to consider what in life is truly important.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fed Chair Jerome Powell talked about the pandemic’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-17/fed-s-powell-says-pandemic-is-molding-extraordinary-generation?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">effect</a> on students at a town hall meeting yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The 21 most exciting young musicians on planet Earth. (<a href="https://www.gq.com/story/voices-of-the-future?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GQ</a>)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STRATEGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/palantir-buys-507-million-worth-gold-bars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Palantir Loads Up on Physical Bitcoin
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Lots of gold bars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjgwL2xvdHNfb2ZfZ29sZF9iYXJzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Palantir, the data analytics software company cofounded by Peter Thiel, revealed in a filing that it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/17/palantir-bought-50-million-in-gold-bars-in-august-as-cash-accumulates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought $50.7 million</a> worth of 100-ounce gold bars.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Why?</strong></span><span> “You have to be prepared for a future with more black swan events,” COO Shyam Sankar </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/palantir-buys-51-million-gold-173724022.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a></span><span>. A black swan event is a potentially devastating economic crisis that no one sees coming—like, say, Covid-19.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Where? </strong></span><span>The gold will be stored in a secure location in the northeastern US, so...nowhere near a New York bar's coatrack. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gold is considered a safe-haven asset that offers protection against inflation. However, it is down about 7% this year even as consumer prices have surged.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>A small but growing number of public companies have put their cash to work by buying bitcoin (most famously, Tesla).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Palantir is putting its own spin on the genre, investing in gold bars and pouring $250 million into startups that use Palantir software. As for putting bitcoin on its balance sheet, “The short answer is yes, we’re thinking about it,” finance chief Dave Glazer said in May. — <em>NF</em></p>

SPONSORED BY PAYCOM

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Your people want the power</strong>. Employee-driven payroll is the next great HR revolution, and you can be ahead of the curve. How? By <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/23/payroll-people" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reading the article we put together with our pals at Paycom</a>. In it, you’ll learn how putting payroll in the hands of the people can reduce employer liability and increase transparency. Oh, and there’s even a pretty nifty piece of tech in there called Beti you might want to get acquainted with. All the details are here in our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/23/payroll-people" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest article</a> with the HR pros at Paycom. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/23/payroll-people" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it here.</a></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Word Search: </strong>All you need is a ball and a hoop to complete today's puzzle. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/17/word-search-nba-logos?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play it here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">For the Gram </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can you spot the grammar errors in the following <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/vol-33-no-8-currencies-01599692051?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ sentences</a>? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The hackers all met in an online forum called OGUsers, where access to a variety of gaming, social media and other types of accounts are bought and sold, investigators say.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The case shone a light on the security practices of a company that is facing pressure from many fronts.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Continental voters would be loathe to scrap the EU, but they increasingly want to change it.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The traders took turns driving coffles of heavily shackled, ill-clad, barely fed chattel as many as 1,000 miles on foot.</span></li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

\u003cem\u003ereally \u003c/em\u003egood at making you buy them things—and that may be key to jumpstarting a stagnant retail industry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the return to in-person education, total back-to-school spending in the US will hit a \u003ca href=\"https://nrf.com/media-center/press-releases/2021-brings-back-class-shopping-record-levels?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord $37.1 billion\u003c/a\u003e this year, up from $33.9 billion in 2020, according to the National Retail Federation’s annual survey. Families with children in elementary through high school plan to spend an average of $848.90 on school supplies, a $59 increase over last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eStores could use the youthful energy\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRetail sales fell \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/17/retail-sales-july-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than expected\u003c/a\u003e (-1.1%) in July, the Commerce Department said yesterday. That dip can likely be explained by skittishness over the Delta variant, as well as a broader shift in spending from goods to services during the summer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWalmart and Home Depot, which both reported earnings yesterday, revealed a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmarts-sales-rise-even-as-online-orders-cool-11629200484?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslowdown\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in sales growth from earlier this year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd remember, consumer sentiment plunged to its lowest level sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePlus, we’re in a pandemic\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd that means things cost more and there’s not enough of them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith inflation on the rise, consumers should expect to pay \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/shopping/2021/07/23/school-supply-shortage-backpack-shoes-could-sell-out/8071293002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10%–15% more\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e compared to last year for apparel, according to USA Today. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eChalk, wooden block sets, and dry-erase markers are in short supply due to shipping delays and other supply chain hiccups, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/08/16/school-shortages-bus-drivers-counselors-computer/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to the Washington Post\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEven worse, a Cincinnati-area Walmart ran out of all \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wcpo.com/money/consumer/dont-waste-your-money/back-to-school-shopping-families-facing-shortages-and-higher-prices?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDisney backpacks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn the bright side...\u003c/strong\u003eif Walmart is any indication (it is), the back-to-school shopping season has started off with a bang. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHope you have enough storage in your phone for one more vaccine selfie: The White House is expected to announce this week that most Americans will \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/16/us/politics/booster-shots.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eneed a Covid booster shot\u003c/a\u003e eight months after their second doses. After the FDA authorized Pfizer’s and Moderna’s boosters for some Americans last week, the third dose could be available for your arm as early as mid-September, per the NYT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy booster shots?\u003c/strong\u003e Growing case numbers in highly vaccinated countries show that vaccine effectiveness may wear off over time, particularly against the Delta variant.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIsrael reported that the Pfizer vaccine’s effectiveness against severe disease has fallen to as low as 55% for elderly people who received their second shots in January or February. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNearly 1 million Israelis have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/covid-vaccine-israel-one-million-booster-shot-delta-variant-1.10121503?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealready received\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e booster shots.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNIH Director Dr. Francis Collins said the data from Israel prompted US health officials to rethink their position on dose No. 3.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out\u003c/strong\u003e: Wealthy countries are full-steam ahead with their booster programs, despite the WHO calling on them to share vaccines with lower-income nations Instead, the app will act as a marketing vehicle for the main website experience. href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/26/onlyfans-grew-revenue-553-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e553% higher\u003c/a\u003e last year, the app will also feature chefs, pilates instructors, and podcasters.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePalantir, the data analytics software company cofounded by Peter Thiel, revealed in a filing that it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/17/palantir-bought-50-million-in-gold-bars-in-august-as-cash-accumulates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebought $50.7 million\u003c/a\u003e worth of 100-ounce gold bars.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “You have to be prepared for a future with more black swan events,” COO Shyam Sankar \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/palantir-buys-51-million-gold-173724022.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. A black swan event is a potentially devastating economic crisis that no one sees coming—like, say, Covid-19.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhere? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe gold will be stored in a secure location in the northeastern US, so...nowhere near a New York bar's coatrack. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGold is considered a safe-haven asset that offers protection against inflation. However, it is down about 7% this year even as consumer prices have surged.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eA small but growing number of public companies have put their cash to work by buying bitcoin (most famously, Tesla).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Palantir is putting its own spin on the genre, investing in gold bars and pouring $250 million into startups that use Palantir software. As for putting bitcoin on its balance sheet, “The short answer is yes, we’re thinking about it,” finance chief Dave Glazer said in May. — \u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!--
